name: Wonton Soup
description: Recipe VIDEO above. Homemade wontons are amazing! No fillers, just real ingredients in the filling. Terrific standby freezer meal!
recipeIngredient: 200 g / 7 oz   lean pork mince ((ground pork))
200 g / 7 oz   peeled prawns / shrimp (, roughly chopped)
2  shallots / green onions (, finely chopped (5 tbsp))
⅓" / 1 cm   piece of ginger (, sliced (optional, but highly recommended))
Bok choy (, quartered, or Chinese broccoli cut into 10cm /4" lengths (optional))
40 - 50 g / 1.5 - 1.75 oz   dried egg noodles per person (, (optional) (8))

itemListElement.text: Place Filling ingredients in a bowl. Use a potato masher to mash until fairly smooth - about 20 mashes. Don't turn the prawn into a complete paste, small chunks are good.
itemListElement.name: Place Filling ingredients in a bowl. Use a potato masher to mash until fairly smooth - about 20 mashes. Don't turn the prawn into a complete paste, small chunks are good.

itemListElement.text: Use My Way (better Wonton Soup experience!) or the Asian Grocery Store Way (easier to pack for freezing).
itemListElement.name: Use My Way (better Wonton Soup experience!) or the Asian Grocery Store Way (easier to pack for freezing).

itemListElement.text: Lay Wontons on work surface. Use 2 teaspoons to put the Filling on the wontons. Work in batches of 5 if starting out, up to 15 or 20 if confident. Brush 2 edges with water. Fold to seal, pressing out air. Brush water on one corner and bring corners together, pressing to seal.
itemListElement.name: Lay Wontons on work surface. Use 2 teaspoons to put the Filling on the wontons. Work in batches of 5 if starting out, up to 15 or 20 if confident. Brush 2 edges with water. Fold to seal, pressing out air. Brush water on one corner and bring corners together, pressing to seal.

itemListElement.text: Place wrapped wontons into a container with a lid as you work (so they don't dry out).
itemListElement.name: Place wrapped wontons into a container with a lid as you work (so they don't dry out).

itemListElement.text: To cook: bring a large pot of water to boil. Place wontons in water and cook for 4 minutes or until they float. Remove with slotted spoon straight into serving bowls. Ladle over broth.
itemListElement.name: To cook: bring a large pot of water to boil. Place wontons in water and cook for 4 minutes or until they float. Remove with slotted spoon straight into serving bowls. Ladle over broth.

itemListElement.text: To freeze: Freeze uncooked in airtight containers. Cook from frozen for 6 to 8 minutes. IMPORTANT: Do not freeze if you made this with defrosted frozen prawns. (Note 11)
itemListElement.name: To freeze: Freeze uncooked in airtight containers. Cook from frozen for 6 to 8 minutes. IMPORTANT: Do not freeze if you made this with defrosted frozen prawns. (Note 11)

itemListElement.text: Place Broth ingredients in a saucepan over high heat. Add white ends of scallions/shallots if leftover from Wonton filling.
itemListElement.name: Place Broth ingredients in a saucepan over high heat. Add white ends of scallions/shallots if leftover from Wonton filling.

itemListElement.text: Place lid on, bring to simmer then reduce to medium high and simmer for 5 - 10 minutes to allow the flavours to infuse. Pick garlic and ginger out before using.
itemListElement.name: Place lid on, bring to simmer then reduce to medium high and simmer for 5 - 10 minutes to allow the flavours to infuse. Pick garlic and ginger out before using.

itemListElement.text: If using vegetables, blanch in the soup broth and place in serving bowl.
itemListElement.name: If using vegetables, blanch in the soup broth and place in serving bowl.

itemListElement.text: Prepare noodles according to packet directions (if using noodles). Place in serving bowl with cooked wontons and blanched vegetables.
itemListElement.name: Prepare noodles according to packet directions (if using noodles). Place in serving bowl with cooked wontons and blanched vegetables.

review.reviewBody: Excellent recipe, tastes amazing.  Prep time is off,  not sure how to get 20 min unless you’re using child labor. Took me minimum 2 hours.  Good rainy day recipe.

Are used the broth base only and she did with frozen potstickers. I also added Julie and carrots and Napa cabbage. I haven’t been feeling well and wanted to refreshing flavors.
So I will comment on the broth
WOW ❤️. I followed every thing exactly, but I had to use Ozeki dry sake because that was the best I found in my three nearest supermarkets. It worked!  
This is exactly the flavor profile I was craving and as another person stated I don’t have to look anywhere else for a Chinese soup broth base. 
I’ve never had the confidence to make a Chinese tasting dish other than stir fried rice, so I’m super excited to find this. Can you tell!  Thank you for sharing

I came across this recipe years ago and have been making this soup ever since. This is the most delicious wonton soup I’ve ever tasted…and I grew up in NYC in the mecca of delectable Asian cuisine. I’ve made this soup for all of my family member over the years, and my 4 year old is constantly asking me for “moms wonton soup”- no one tell him the recipe isn’t mine..ha! Thank you for this incredible dish, and the easy breakdown on how to cook. You are very appreciated.

Made this for dinner last night and the kiddos & I flipping loved it - the wontons are SO delicious.  The leftover uncooked wontons are in the freezer an neighbouring the extra broth I made - super low lift dinner in my near future!
A winner, everyone loved it! But then again we have loved every one of your recipes and the Dozer stories. Merry Christmas and Happy New Year!
I make batches of these with friends, we split them up, and each of us takes home enough for a few meals. Best way to while away an afternoon, while preparing for cold winter evenings.
